name: Death of Ernest Augustus
obverse: A pyramid flanked by two trees. A crack runs down the middle of the medal. This crack appears on all medals of this kind.
reverse: Blank. This medal is a cliché so it only has one side. The obverse on the minted medals depicted Ernest Augustus, whose death this medal commemorates.
references: Münzen- und medaillen-cabinet des justizraths Abth. 2 #3859
description: Ernest Augustus (German: Ernst August; 20 November 1629 – 23 January 1698), was a Duke of Brunswick-Lüneburg and ruled over the Principality of Calenberg (with its capital Hanover) subdivision of the duchy.
He was appointed Prince-elector, but died before the appointment became effective. He was also the Prince-Bishop of the Prince-Bishopric of Osnabrück.
